TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer extends System.Text.EncoderFallbackBuffer
Public NotInheritable Class EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer Inherits EncoderFallbackBuffer
public ref class EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer sealed : System::Text::EncoderFallbackBuffer

Docs.summary: Represents a substitute input string that is used when the original input character cannot be encoded. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks It might not be possible to convert a character to an equivalent encoded byte sequence if no suitable encoding exists. A common reason for an encoding to fail is if the conversion operation uses a code page that cannot represent the character to encode.
If the input character cannot be converted to an output byte sequence, a <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallback?displayProperty=nameWithType> object provides a replacement string that is substituted for the original input character. The replacement string initializes the value of the <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallback> object, and the value of the <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallback> object initializes the value of an <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer> object. The value of an <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer> object is called the replacement fallback buffer. The conversion operation encodes the replacement fallback buffer instead of the original input character, then continues to process the remainder of the input.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Fallback (char charUnknown, int index);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Fallback(char charUnknown, int32 index) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Fallback (charUnknown As Char, index As Integer) As Boolean
public: override bool Fallback(char charUnknown, int index);

Docs.param: An input character. This parameter is ignored in this operation unless an exception is thrown.
The index position of the character in the input buffer. This parameter is ignored in this operation.
Docs.summary: Prepares the replacement fallback buffer to use the current replacement string.
Docs.returns: if the replacement string is not empty; if the replacement string is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Text.Encoding.GetBytes%2A> and <xref:System.Text.Encoder.Convert%2A> methods call <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> if they encounter an unknown character in their input. If the return value of <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> is `true`, the calling method can invoke the <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar%2A> method to obtain each character in the replacement fallback buffer.

Docs.exception: This method is called again before the method has read all the characters in the replacement fallback buffer.

override this.Fallback : char * char * int -> bool

Docs.param: The high surrogate of the input pair.
The low surrogate of the input pair.
The index position of the surrogate pair in the input buffer.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a replacement string can be used when an input surrogate pair cannot be encoded, or whether the surrogate pair can be ignored. Parameters specify the surrogate pair and the index position of the pair in the input.
Docs.returns: if the replacement string is not empty; if the replacement string is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Text.Encoding.GetBytes%2A> and <xref:System.Text.Encoder.Convert%2A> methods call <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> if they encounter an unknown character in their input. If the return value of <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> is `true`, the calling method can invoke the <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar%2A> method to obtain each character in the replacement fallback buffer.

Docs.exception: This method is called again before the method has read all the replacement string characters.

The value of is less than U+D800 or greater than U+D8FF.
-or-
The value of is less than U+DC00 or greater than U+DFFF.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance char GetNextChar() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetNextChar () As Char

Docs.summary: Retrieves the next character in the replacement fallback buffer.
Docs.returns: The next Unicode character in the replacement fallback buffer that the application can encode.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Text.Encoding.GetBytes%2A> and <xref:System.Text.Encoder.Convert%2A> methods call <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> if they encounter an unknown surrogate pair or character in their input. If the return value of <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> is `true`, the calling method can invoke <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar%2A> to obtain each character in the replacement fallback buffer.

Docs.summary: Causes the next call to the method to access the character position in the replacement fallback buffer prior to the current character position.
Docs.returns: if the operation was successful; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Remaining As Integer
public: virtual property int Remaining { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of characters in the replacement fallback buffer that remain to be processed.
Docs.value: The number of characters in the replacement fallback buffer that have not yet been processed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> method returns `true` if the <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Remaining%2A> property is nonzero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes all internal state information and data in this instance of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Reset%2A> method discards any persisted state information and data that govern emitting a replacement string. Unpredictable results occur if the encoding operation continues after the <xref:System.Text.EncoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Reset%2A> method is invoked.
